titles.title: Hakkenden: Touhou Hakken Ibun (2013)
Hakkenden - Eight Dogs of the East S2
八犬伝 -東方八犬異聞- (2013)
Hakkenden: Eight Dogs of the East (2013)

category.name: Shoujo
category.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word shoujo refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. In Japanese, the word means simply "young female", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic. Still, while not mandatory, some easily identifiable traits are generally common to shoujo works, such as: simple and often one-sided romance; the daily life and dreams of an average girl; common girls who suddenly develop or receive magical powers, thus becoming "magical girls" (see "mahou shoujo"). Additionally, the art style of shoujo tends to be rather flowery, and the plots tend to be less complex than josei, but neither of those is a requirement.

category.name: Talking Animals
category.description: Despite the fact that they look like regular animals, they speak and understand human language.

category.name: Bishounen
category.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

category.name: Earth
category.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun. It is a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). To its inhabitants, our planet is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. The Earth is the main setting of most fiction, but many titles are set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, and in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by invaders.

category.name: Manga
category.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse.

category.name: Japan
category.description: Last stronghold for humanity, if Tokyo falls, it`s all over. Tokyo Tower will undoubtedly fall anyway.

category.name: Asia
category.description: Asia is the world`s largest and most populous continent.

category.name: Past
category.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: half-demon half-human
tag.description: Someone who is half-demon half-human either by birth or made from magic, holy power, science or some type of phenomena etc. Most commonly share physical and mental traits of both species.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia] This tag should be used for shows where the plot is heavily influenced by, if not based upon, the folklore of a culture. See also: fairy tale

tag.name: animal transforms into weapon
tag.description: A being that appears to be a normal animal, is actually something much more, for it can transform into a weapon.

character.name: Inuzuka Shino
character.description: Holder of the DEVOTION bead. Shino is one of three teens who survived the destruction of Otsuka Village. Five years ago, he found himself near dying as his village burned, but chose life over death and now harbors the living spirit sword http://anidb.net/ch49445 [Murasame] on his arm. He has a birthmark in the shape of a peony flower on his right arm. When young, he was weak and was dressed up like a girl. He feels special attachment to http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji], who grew up with him. Source: ANN

character.name: Inukawa Sousuke
character.description: Holder of the DUTY bead. Sousuke also survived the fiery destruction of Otsuka Village. He did not have relatives and was raised with http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49444 [Hamaji] as if they were siblings. For Shino, Sosuke is like his supervisor. He has a peony-shaped birthmark on the back of his neck. Ever since the accident that happened 5 years ago, he has an ability to transform into the dog Yoshiro. Source: ANN

character.name: Hamaji
character.description: Hamaji is like a sister to http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino] and http://anidb.net/ch49443 [Sousuke], having been raised with them since childhood. Along with them, she survived the destruction of Otsuka Village. She is something of a health nut, and obsessed with making sure everyone around her maintains a proper diet, but her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired. Unlike her pretty appearance, she often manipulates Shino and Sousuke, but in heart, she cares about them. Source: ANN

character.name: Murasame
character.description: Murasame is a living spirit sword rumored to hold sway over all things without shape or form, but it is said that whomever the sword possesses will meet a violent and tragic end. The blade ordinarily takes the form of a crow and speaks in human language, concealing itself on http://anidb.net/ch49442 [Shino]`s right arm when resting. Murasame sometimes picks and eats food that somebody dropped, and Shino scolds Murasame for the behavior. Source: ANN

character.name: Inukai Genpachi
character.description: Holder of the INTEGRITY bead. Genpachi is a captain of the imperial military police. Like his foster brother http://anidb.net/ch50984 [Kobungo], Genpachi was sent on assignment in the north three years ago and returned a changed man. Now he transforms into a demon who preys on supernatural beings. He and Kobungo`s sister Nui had become lovers before his assignment, but by the time he returned she had committed suicide. His peony-flower birthmark is on his right cheek. Source: ANN

character.name: Inuta Kobungo
character.description: Holder of the FRATERNITY bead. Kobungo`s family runs the Konaya bed-and-breakfast inn, and Kobungo himself is excellent at caring for people`s needs. Three years ago, he volunteered as a foot soldier and accompanied his foster brother http://anidb.net/ch50983 [Genpachi] in an army deployment sent to contain an incident taking place in a remote northern village, where the two of them were brutally attacked by man-eating demons. But the brothers came back to life with changed bodies, now able to transform into demons themselves. Kobungo`s peony-flower birthmark is on his lower back. Source: ANN

character.name: Megu
character.description: One-eyed monster which has the appearance of a black sphere.

character.name: Yuki-hime
character.description: Snow Princess and a friend of Shino.

character.name: Hinozuka Nachi
character.description: One of the four members of the "Four Sacred Beast Houses", he is capable of summoning a large black panther called Kaede. He tends to have a laid back personality, but can be serious when he wants to. He also seems to be privy to Rio`s secrets and tends to act in the shadows (not to mention takes his time on missions). His panther doesn`t like the main House too much, saying it`s much too crowded with all the other Beasts there.
